{{Infobox Military Structure |name = Swerford Castle |location = [[Swerford]], [[Oxfordshire]], England |coordinates = {{gbmapping|SP372311}} |coord_region = GB |coord_display = title |image = [[Image:Motte and Bailey, Swerford - geograph.org.uk - 215450.jpg|225px]] |caption = The remaining earthworks |map_type = Oxfordshire |latitude = 51.9777 |longitude = -1.4592 |map_size = 200 |map_alt = |map_caption = Shown within [[Oxfordshire]] |type = [[Motte and bailey]] |materials = |height = |condition = Earthworks remain |ownership = |open_to_public = |battles = |events = }} '''Swerford Castle''' was a medieval [[castle]] in the village of [[Swerford]], [[Oxfordshire]], [[England]].
==History==
Swerford Castle was built in a [[motte and bailey]] design in the 12th century.<ref name=NatHer>''[http://list.english-heritage.org.uk/resultsingle.aspx?uid=1014748 List entry Number: 1014748]'', the National Heritage List, English Heritage, accessed 9 June 2011.</ref> It was positioned so as to overlook the local [[ford]] of the [[River Swere]] and the village of [[Swerford]].<ref name=NatHer/> Archaeological remains suggest that the castle was probably constructed during the years of [[the Anarchy]], probably by the same family that built [[Ascot d'Oilly Castle]].<ref name=NatHer/>
The central motte is 18 m wide in diameter on top, and 30 m in diameter at the base, and 4 m tall; the wider bailey is approximately 52 m by 42 m, with a deep ditch.<ref name=NatHer/> The remains today are a [[scheduled monument]].<ref name=NatHer/>
==See also== *[[Castles in Great Britain and Ireland]] *[[List of castles in England]]
